required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of Cricoid and Paratracheal Pressures for Occluding Esophagus
clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness of Cricoid and Paratracheal Pressures for Occluding Esophagus in Anesthetized and Paralyzed Patients During Direct and Video Laryngoscopies

brief_summary.textblock: Comparing the effects of 'Cricoid pressure' or 'Paratracheal pressure' during direct laryngoscopy

detailed_description.textblock: The effectiveness of cricoid pressure and paratracheal pressure for occluding esophagus during direct and video laryngoscopies.

primary_outcome.time_frame: during 2 min under direct and video laryngoscopies
primary_outcome.description: Occlusion of esophagus is checked with the application of cricoid and paratracehal pressures using esophageal stethoscope.

secondary_outcome.measure: Occlusion of esophagus between direct and video laryngoscopies
secondary_outcome.description: Occlusion of esophagus is checked under the application of cricoid and paratracheal pressures between direct and video laryngoscopies
POGO score under the application of cricoid and paratracheal pressures

arm_group.description: Cricoid pressure is applied during direct and video laryngoscopies
Cricoid pressure is applied during direct and video laryngoscopies

intervention.description: Cricoid pressure: pressure on the cricoid ring Paratracheal pressure: pressure on the left paratracheal region below the cricoid level

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Who would be scheduled any surgery under general anesthesia and agree with the purpose of the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Risk of aspiration Limited neck extension Facial and upper airway anomalies History of esophageal surgery, esophagus abnormalities
